name: Bruno
tagline: Open-source, privacy-first API client for developers
description: Bruno is an open-source API client designed for Windows 10/11, focusing on privacy and local-first workflows. It replaces cloud-dependent tools with file-based collections (stored as folders/files on your system) for REST, GraphQL, and gRPC APIs. Features include intuitive request building, environment variables, dark/light mode sync with Windows themes, and support for OAuth2, JWT, and API keys. Integrates seamlessly with Windows File Explorer (associates .bru files) and can be installed via winget or official EXE. No mandatory cloud sync—keep your API data local and secure, with optional Bruno Hub for team collaboration.
key_features: Privacy-first local API collections (no default cloud sync)
Supports REST, GraphQL, and gRPC APIs
Native Windows integration (winget install, file associations)
pros: Open-source and completely free (no paid tiers)
Dark/light mode sync with Windows system themes
cons: Smaller plugin ecosystem compared to Postman
Limited enterprise collaboration features
No built-in cloud sync (optional via Bruno Hub with basic functionality)

faqs.question: Is Bruno compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, Bruno runs natively on Windows 11 (and Windows 10) with full support for system features like theme sync and file associations.

faqs.question: Is it safe to install?
faqs.answer: Yes—Bruno is open-source (code hosted on GitHub) and distributed via official channels (EXE installer, winget). It has no malicious code or hidden tracking.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version?
faqs.answer: Yes! Bruno offers a portable ZIP download for Windows, allowing you to run it from a USB drive or external storage without installation.

name: Hoppscotch
tagline: Lightweight API testing tool for Windows developers
description: Hoppscotch is an open-source, modern API client designed for Windows developers to test and debug APIs quickly. It integrates smoothly with Windows OS—supporting system shortcuts, dark mode alignment with Windows settings, and native installation via Microsoft Store or portable version. Features include REST/GraphQL/WebSocket support, environment variables, offline functionality, and minimal resource usage. Ideal for Windows users seeking a fast, lightweight alternative to heavy API clients, it lets you send requests, inspect responses, and manage API workflows efficiently without compromising performance.
cons: Limited advanced features (e.g., automated test suites) compared to premium tools
No built-in team collaboration in the desktop version
Less extensive documentation than some competitors

faqs.question: Is Hoppscotch compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, Hoppscotch works seamlessly with Windows 11. It supports native installation via the Microsoft Store and aligns with Windows 11’s design guidelines, including dark mode and system shortcut integration.

faqs.question: Is it safe to install?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Hoppscotch is open-source (hosted on GitHub) with a transparent codebase. You can install it via the official Microsoft Store or download the portable version from its website—both options are secure and free of malware.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version?
faqs.answer: Yes, Hoppscotch offers a portable version for Windows. You can download it from the official website, unzip it, and run it without any installation—perfect for using on multiple devices without admin rights.

name: HTTP Toolkit
tagline: Intercept, inspect, and debug HTTP(S) traffic for Windows API development
description: HTTP Toolkit is a essential tool for Windows API developers, enabling interception and analysis of HTTP/HTTPS traffic from any app—browsers, desktop tools, CLI, and more. It integrates with Windows' network stack for easy setup, supports TLS decryption via local root certificates, and offers a clean interface to inspect headers, payloads, response times, and WebSocket messages. You can mock responses, throttle connections, and export data for debugging. Works seamlessly with Windows 10/11, integrates with VS Code, and has free/pro tiers for basic or advanced use cases.
key_features: Intercept HTTP(S) traffic from any Windows application
Mock API responses and throttle network connections
Inspect detailed request/response data (headers, payloads, TLS) and WebSockets
pros: Easy setup with native Windows network integration
Free tier available for basic debugging needs
cons: Advanced features (team collaboration, custom scripts) locked behind Pro plan
Requires local root certificate installation for TLS decryption

faqs.question: Is HTTP Toolkit compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, HTTP Toolkit fully supports Windows 11, as well as Windows 10. It leverages Windows' network capabilities to intercept traffic from all apps without compatibility issues.

faqs.question: Is it safe to install?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. HTTP Toolkit generates a local root certificate for TLS decryption (never shared externally), and its core is open-source. It does not collect or share your traffic data with third parties.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version?
faqs.answer: Currently, HTTP Toolkit does not offer an official portable version for Windows. The installer is required to set up necessary components for traffic interception and OS integration.

description: Figma is a cloud-powered graphic design tool tailored for Windows 10/11, enabling real-time collaboration on UI/UX designs, illustrations, and interactive prototypes. It integrates seamlessly with Windows features like touch inputs, high-DPI displays, system shortcuts, and taskbar notifications. Users can work offline with automatic sync when online, export assets in PNG/SVG/PDF formats, and leverage component libraries for consistent design. Ideal for teams and individuals, it combines vector editing, prototyping, and collaboration in one intuitive interface.

name: Timelens
tagline: Smart time-tracking and productivity analytics for Windows
description: Timelens is a Windows-focused productivity tool that tracks screen time, categorizes app usage, and helps set actionable goals. It integrates with Windows Task Manager for real-time activity data and syncs with Microsoft Calendar to align time logs with scheduled tasks. The app generates detailed daily/weekly reports to spot time-wasters, lets you set app usage limits to cut distractions, and exports data to Excel for analysis. It supports Windows 10/11 dark mode, runs quietly in the background without lag, and offers keyboard shortcuts for quick access—ideal for professionals and students aiming to boost focus.
cons: Free version limits report customization

faqs.question: Is Timelens compatible with Windows 11?

name: ToDoList

The app features dark mode (aligned with Windows 10/11 themes), system tray access for quick edits, and keyboard shortcuts to boost productivity. It auto-saves progress, allows exporting tasks to Excel/PDF, and lets users categorize tasks into projects—ideal for staying organized without clutter.

name: WordWeb

name: Algo
tagline: Secure self-hosted VPN solution for privacy-focused Windows users
description: Algo is a self-hosted VPN tool tailored for Windows users who prioritize privacy and control. It simplifies deploying a secure VPN server using open-source protocols like WireGuard and IKEv2—both natively supported on Windows 10/11. With no logging policies and strong encryption, it ensures your online activity remains private. Setup uses straightforward scripts, and once deployed, Windows users can connect via native VPN clients without extra software. It avoids third-party providers, giving you full ownership of your data, making it ideal for bypassing restrictions while maintaining complete privacy.
pros: Full control over VPN server data
Works with Windows native VPN clients
Regular security updates from the community
cons: Requires basic technical knowledge to set up the server
No graphical user interface (CLI-only setup)
Not suitable for users who prefer managed VPN services
Limited to self-hosted server options

faqs.question: Is Algo compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, Algo fully supports Windows 11. It works with native Windows clients for WireGuard and IKEv2, which are integrated into Windows 11’s network settings, allowing seamless connection without additional software.

faqs.question: Is it safe to install Algo?
faqs.answer: Yes, Algo is safe. It is an open-source project hosted on GitHub with code reviewed by security experts. As a self-hosted solution, it eliminates risks associated with third-party VPN providers, and uses industry-standard encryption protocols to protect your online activity.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version of Algo?
faqs.answer: Algo itself is a set of command-line scripts (not a desktop app), so there’s no portable version. However, once your Algo server is deployed, you can connect to it from any Windows device using native VPN clients (WireGuard or IKEv2) without installing extra software.

name: Cloudflare WARP
tagline: Fast, private internet access for Windows
description: Cloudflare WARP encrypts Windows internet traffic via the WireGuard protocol, integrating seamlessly with Windows 10/11 (system tray access, auto-start options, native network compatibility). It uses Cloudflare’s 1.1.1.1 DNS to block trackers and speed up connections through Cloudflare’s global network. Setup is one-click with a simple interface for toggling VPN on/off. The free version offers basic privacy protection, while WARP+ (paid) unlocks faster speeds and priority routing for enhanced performance.

faqs.answer: Yes, Cloudflare WARP is fully compatible with Windows 11, as well as Windows 10 (version 1709 or later). It integrates smoothly with Windows 11’s system tray and native network settings.

faqs.answer: Absolutely. Cloudflare WARP is developed by Cloudflare, a trusted internet security leader. It uses open-source WireGuard protocol and does not log browsing activity, ensuring privacy and safety.

name: ProtonVPN
tagline: Secure, privacy-first VPN for Windows
description: ProtonVPN is a privacy-centric VPN tool optimized for Windows, offering end-to-end AES-256 encryption and a strict no-logs policy. It integrates with Windows security features like TPM 2.0 for secure key storage, supports split tunneling to select which apps use the VPN, and includes a kill switch to prevent data leaks if the connection drops. The intuitive interface aligns with Windows design guidelines, working seamlessly with Windows 10 and 11. It provides access to servers in over 60 countries, P2P support on selected servers, and NetShield for ad/tracker blocking.
pros: Free tier available with basic privacy features

cons: Free tier has limited server access and speed
